creator: apang@mdsi.ca
text:
The WAVE "magic" probably doesn't work:

0       string          RIFF            audio/unknown
>8      string          WAVE            audio/x-wav

I used it as a reference to see if I could send application/xhtml+xml for (my)
XHTML documents, and text/xml as the default for other XML documents.

Using:

0   string      \<?xml      text/xml
>44 string      \<!DOCTYPE\ HTML    application/xhtml+xml

The content type for an XHTML document, rather unexpectedly, returned:
"text/xml" followed by some trailing garbage text.

Note: this is a low priority (for me) as I've since discovered that IE6 does not
recognize "application/xhtml+xml" (as mentioned in 5.1 of the XHTML 1.0 spec.).

Hi Anthon,

I am cleaning up old tickets/bugs and this one seems really ancient. I didn't fully get the issue, I would be inclined to close this bug.

Please re-open the ticket if you want further assistance!

Luca
creator: toscano.luca@gmail.com
christophe.jaillet@wanadoo.fr
text: This could be related to r1491700
